content:
:wave: @WG-rls2.0 @Vadim Petrochenkov @Aaron Hill @LeSeulArtichaut @eddyb @Christopher Durham

This is a t-compiler/wg-parselib Zulip stream, which I suggest to use as the main point of coordination for parse library-ification work. I liberally subscribed a number of potentially interested folks to it. Feel free to unsubscribe if you don't want to follow this (but also feel free to subscribe anybody I've missed :smiling_devil: )

At the moment, I personally am in the "poking rustc parser here & there" stage, and I'll just this stream to do unstructured brained dumps.

Hopefully a more definite road map will become clearer soon-ish :)

Just to make sure folks are on the same page, the specific narrow goal we have in mind for this work is:

rust-analyzer and rustc share the parser's code. That means that the parser is both production ready and capable of producing full-fidelity syntax trees from incomplete source code.
I've created https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/254930-t-compiler.2Fwg-parselib/topic/worklist as a sort-of persistent call-for-participation.

I've also added a label to the rust-lang/rust:

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/labels/WG-parselib
